Package bomberman.model.player

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • bomberman.model.GameElement
      • bomberman.model.player.Player
  • public class Player
extends GameElement
    Encapsulates everything the players have in common. (e.g. moving, planting bombs)
    Author:
    Felix Bachmann

      int getBombsLeft()
      Returns the amount of bombs left for the player.
      int getId()
      Returns the id of this player.
      int getMaxBombs()
      Returns the maximum amount of bombs the player may plant at once.
      java.awt.image.BufferedImage getSprite​(int spriteSize)
      Reads the sprite from disk (if not done yet) and return a BufferedImage of it.

      Returns the URL of the sprite.
      TileCoordinate getTileCoordinate()
      Returns the TileCoordinate of this player. (= "hitbox" of this player)

      Returns the x-position of the player.
      int getY()
      Returns the y-position of the player.
      void hit()
      Hits the player, that is decrements the lifes of the player by 1.
      boolean isAlive()
      Returns true if the player is alive, false otherwise.
      private void move​(Direction dir)
      Private method to encapsulate movement (algorithms are quite similar).
      void moveDown()
      Will move the player downward if possible.

      Will move the player leftward if possible.

      Will move the player rightward if possible.
      void moveUp()
      Will move the player upward if possible.

      Tries to plant a bomb.

      Sets the amount of bombs the player is still able to plant.

        public int getId()
        Returns the id of this player. It is unique amongst all players.
        Returns:
        the id

        Returns true if the player is alive, false otherwise.

      • setBombsLeft

        public void setBombsLeft​(int bombsLeft)
        Sets the amount of bombs the player is still able to plant.
        Parameters:
        bombsLeft - the amount of bombs, has to be greater than or equal 0.

      • setGame

        public void setGame​(Game game)
             throws IllegalIdRequestException
        Sets the game this player plays. Only has an effect once hence the game is not allowed to change in the lifetime of a player.
        Parameters:
        game - the game to set
        Throws:
        IllegalIdRequestException - is thrown if there is no id for this player in the game because the game is already full

      • moveUp

        public void moveUp()
        Will move the player upward if possible.

      • moveDown

        public void moveDown()
        Will move the player downward if possible.

      • moveLeft

        public void moveLeft()
        Will move the player leftward if possible.

      • moveRight

        public void moveRight()
        Will move the player rightward if possible.

      • move

        private void move​(Direction dir)
        Private method to encapsulate movement (algorithms are quite similar).
        Parameters:
        dir - the direction in which the player may move

      • hit

        public void hit()
        Hits the player, that is decrements the lifes of the player by 1.

      • plantBomb

        public void plantBomb()
        Tries to plant a bomb. Only has an effect if the player has bombs left to plant. In that case the amount of bombs left will be decremented and the bomb will be planted.

      • getSprite

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getSprite​(int spriteSize)
        Description copied from class: GameElement
        Reads the sprite from disk (if not done yet) and return a BufferedImage of it.
        Overrides:
        getSprite in class GameElement
        Parameters:
        spriteSize - the size of the (QUADRATIC!) tile
        Returns:
        BufferedImage instance of the sprite
